(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The type of substance (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE or CIGARETTES, CIGARS, COFFEE).
field_implementationNotes: Sponsors may require different types of substance-use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be preprinted on the CRF as a label for the prompt for Substance Use. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT should be TOBACCO and SUTRT should be CIGARETTES.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the [name/type] of (the) substance used?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE). Sponsors may require different types of substance-use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be preprinted on the CRF. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS, rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT is TOBACCO and SUTRT is CIGARETTES. If the sponsor does not specify a type of tobacco on the CRF, SUTRT is TOBACCO. If SUCAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is/was the category of the substance (used)?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the SUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The value for subcategory may be preprinted on the CRF or hidden. SUSCAT can only be used if there is a SUCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SUCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the substance (used)?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.
field_implementationNotes: For prespecified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both prespecified and free-text interventions, the value of SUPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether any data was collected for the intervention topic.
field_implementationNotes: General prompt question to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. This is a field that can be used on any Interventions CRF to indicate whether there is data to record.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were any [sponsor-phrase/substance name/recreational drugs] used?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Indication the prespecified substance was used.
field_implementationNotes: The 3 options (NEVER, CURRENT, FORMER) are sponsor-defined in relation to the protocol. If the sponsor has specific definitions, these definitions are detailed in the instructions to the site. As this type of response does not correspond exactly to an SDTM variable, CDASH recommends using the CDASHIG variable SUNCF. Sponsors must decide how to populate the appropriate relative timing variables when creating the SDTM-based datasets. For example, If SUNCF ="Never", the value of SUOCCUR will be "N" and all relative timing variables will be null. If the sponsor chooses to populate the relative start references (SUSTRTPT, SUSTRF) the value will be "BEFORE" when SUNCF= "CURRENT" and "FORMER". If the sponsor also chooses to use relative end references (SUENRF, SUENRTPT) , the SUENRTPT value will be "ONGOING" when SUNCF="CURRENT" while the value of SUENRF will be "DURING/AFTER". \n Note: When using SUSTRTPT and/or SUENRTPT, these must refer to a time-point anchor (e.g., SCREENING, in SUSTTPT/SUENTPT).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate SUOCCUR and relative timing variables.
field_questionText: Has the subject ever [used/consumed] [SUTRT/SUCAT]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation for why data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., subject refused) or entered as free text. When SUREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SUSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the reason the data was not collected?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The amount of substance used (e.g., 1-2 packs, 8 oz).
field_implementationNotes: Where possible, the options for dose/amount are preprinted on the CRF. In the example given in the definition, "packs" and "ounces" are included as a point of reference. They would, of course, be submitted as SUDOSU. Care should be taken to map each record to the appropriate SDTM variable SUDOSTXT (text results that cannot be represented in a numeric field) and SUDOSE (numeric results).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to SUDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to SUDOSTXT in SDTM.
field_questionText: What is/was the amount of [SUTRT] used/consumed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The number/amount of the of substance consumed per a specific interval.
field_implementationNotes: When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are preprinted on the CRF. (e.g., PER DAY, PER WEEK, OCCASIONAL).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the frequency of [SUTRT] [use/consumption]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date substance use started, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY.
field_implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the start date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date substance use ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the end date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Collected duration of the substance use.
field_implementationNotes: This is only collected on the CRF if this level of detail is needed and if SUSTDAT and SUENDAT are not collected on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
field_questionText: What was the duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Unit of the collected duration of the substance use. Used only if duration was collected on the CRF.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined options should be preprinted on the CRF to avoid making this a free-text field. This will allow the response to be translated into ISO 8601 format.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
field_questionText: What was the unit of duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: If the value for SUTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
field_implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of SUTRT, or the modified topic variable (SUMODIFY), if applicable.
field_implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the generic drug name in published (e.g., WHODrug, SNOMED, ICD9) or sponsor-defined dictionaries. If SUPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized substance name is being solicited, the data from SUTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG SUDECOD variable.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether any AEs were experienced during the study.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were any adverse events experienced?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the AECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. AESCAT can only be used if there is an AECAT and it must be a subcategorization of AECAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subcategory of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with AEs. If CMAENO or PRAENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMAENO or PRAENO refers. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The reported or prespecified name of the adverse event.
field_implementationNotes: Can be represented either as an open-entry field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects or preprinted, in the situation where solicited AEs of interest are captured. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF.
field_label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the adverse event term?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a prespecified adverse event or a group of adverse events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH variable AEOCCUR is used to indicate the occurrence of prespecified adverse events (e.g., "Did the subject have high blood pressure?"). AEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported adverse events. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Because the SDTM AE domain is intended to hold only adverse events that actually happen, all values collected in AEOCCUR for prespecified AEs should be submitted in a Findings About Adverse Events data set (FAAE) where FAORRES=the value of AEOCCUR where FATESTCD="OCCUR". In addition, where AEOCCUR="Y", there should be a corresponding record in the AE domain.
field_questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified adverse event/group of adverse events]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that a specific event or group of events are prespecified on a CRF.
field_implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during SDTM-based dataset creation, when the AE is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both prespecified and free-text adverse events, the value of AEPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free-text. AEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start date of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What is the adverse event start date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start time of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time an AE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the AE start time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What is the adverse event start time?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the adverse event.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the anatomical location of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the side of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the directionality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field_implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Indication that an adverse event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field_implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the AE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from AE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AEENRF or AEENRTPT. When populating AEENRF, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating AEENRTPT, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When AEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable AEENRF should be populated. When AEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables AEENRTPT and AEENTPT should be used. Note: AEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in AEENTPT.
field_prompt: Ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])
field_questionText: Is the adverse event ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date when the adverse event resolved/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date (if applicable). Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the adverse event end date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time when the adverse event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time an AE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the AE end time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the adverse event end time?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
field_implementationNotes: Either AESEV or AETOXGR must appear on the CRF. Some studies may mandate the collection of both. Refer to ICH E3 Section 12.2.4.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the severity of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The grade of the severity of the event using a standard "toxicity" scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
field_implementationNotes: Either AESEV or AETOXGR must appear on the CRF. Some studies may mandate the collection of both. Refer to ICH E3 Section 12.2.4. CTCAE grade is commonly used in oncology studies, although it can also be used elsewhere. Other published toxicity-like scales can also be used.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target columnget. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
field_prompt: [NCI CTCAE/ Name of the scale] (Toxicity) Grade
field_questionText: What is the [NCI CTCAE/Name of scale (toxicity) grade] of the adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether the adverse event is determined to be "serious," based on what is defined in the regulations/protocol.
field_implementationNotes: This field is related to the individual SAE-type fields, which may or may not be collected on the CRF. Either AESER or all the SAE-type fields must be present on the CRF. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Was the adverse event serious?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). field_definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
field_implementationNotes: In the CDASH model, Death Date is a timing variable; it is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

field_implementationNotes: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data. "Involves cancer" (AESCAN) and "Occurred with overdose" (AESOD) are not part of the ICH definition of an SAE, but these categories are available for use in studies conducted under guidelines that existed prior to the FDA's adoption of the ICH definition.

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as determined by the clinician/investigator.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology is used to indicate the relationship between the AE and the study treatment (e.g., ICH E2B examples include "Not Related", "Unlikely Related", "Possibly Related", "Related"). Another possibility is the use of "Y" and "N". CDISC Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. It is recommended that sponsors check with the appropriate regulatory authority for population of this variable to ensure it meets expectations for submission. There is no industry-wide controlled terminology for relationship to treatment. It is recommended that sponsors establish terminology and apply it consistently.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Was this adverse event related to study treatment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.
field_implementationNotes: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the action taken with the study treatment in response to the AE. How to handle multiple actions taken is up to the sponsor. If this information is collected elsewhere (e.g., on the Exposure CRF), then it is not required to be collected on the AE CRF. This variable is not to be used for actions taken with devices. See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What action was taken with study treatment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the action taken, with respect to a device used in a study (which may or may not be the device under study), as a result of the event.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology for actions that are related to the device (e.g., device removed, primary care physician notified). See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What action was taken with a device used in the study?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication whether any other actions were taken in response to the adverse event that were unrelated to study treatment dose changes or other non-study treatments given because of this adverse event.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the AEACNOTH field on the CRF was deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of other action taken as a result of the event that is unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.
field_implementationNotes: This is usually collected as a free-text field. If possible/desired, the sponsor can create controlled terminology (e.g., treatment unblinded, primary care physician notified).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What other action was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the outcome of an event.
field_implementationNotes: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the outcome of the event as it relates to the subject's status. The Outcome controlled terminology includes ICH E2B values. The use of this field is the recommended way to describe whether and how the AE resolved. Because the outcome of an AE may be death, if this field is NOT used, be sure to provide another form, such as Disposition, with clear instructions to record deaths there.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the outcome of this adverse event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
field_implementationNotes: Because the Action Taken field was defined to only collect changes made to the study treatment due to the AE, an additional field was created to identify the AE(s) that caused the subject to discontinue from the study. Some sponsors opt to capture this information only on the Subject Disposition CRF, whereas others choose to collect this data on both the Subject Disposition and AE CRFs, so the specific AE term(s) and related data can be identified. If the CRF is designed to link the DS and AE records, then RELREC can be used to identify that relationship.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. May be used to create a RELREC to link the AE to the Disposition record (see the SDTMIG). The sponsor may also submit this data in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEDIS" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Caused Study Discontinuation", if appropriate. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains..
field_questionText: Did the adverse event cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication whether, in the investigator's opinion, the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the CDASH AERELNST field on the CRF was deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Was this adverse event due to treatment other than study treatment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the adverse event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
field_implementationNotes: May be reported as free text (e.g., "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE"). If possible/desired, sponsors can create controlled terminology.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the relationship to non-study treatment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor can be appropriate. Such an event might warrant further investigation in order to characterize and understand it. Depending on the nature of the event, rapid communication by the trial sponsor to other parties (e.g., regulators) might also be warranted.
field_implementationNotes: This CDASH field may be used just to trigger other CRF pages, or populate a value in AECAT or AESCAT. If submitted, this information could be submitted in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AESI" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Adverse Event of Special Interest. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Is this event of special interest?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time.
field_implementationNotes: Used to report the pattern of the AE (e.g., "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT"). For crossover trials, it is NOT recommended to capture this field for intermittent AEs. Instead, the AE should have corresponding start and stop dates to capture when the AE started and stopped.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the adverse event pattern?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication whether a concomitant or additional treatment given because of the occurrence of the event.
field_implementationNotes: If medication data are reported, the CMAENO variable (on the CM CRF) may be used to collect the associated AE Identifier in order to populate RELREC. If procedures are reported, the PRAENO variable (on the PR CRF) may be used to collect the associated AE Identifier in order to populate RELREC.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_prompt: Concomitant or Additional Treatment Given Due to This AE
field_questionText: Was a concomitant or additional treatment given due to this adverse event?
