(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: If the value for AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
field_implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The dictionary or standardized text description of AETERM or the modified topic variable (AEMODIFY), if applicable.
field_implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT) in MedDRA.

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the clinical event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the CECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. CESCAT can only be used if there is an CECAT and it must be a subcategorization of CECAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subcategory of the clinical event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether any clinical events were experienced during the study.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were any clinical events experienced?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with CEs. If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The reported or prespecified name of the clinical event.
field_implementationNotes: Can be represented either as a free-text field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects; or preprinted, in situation where solicited CEs of interest are captured. May be used as Specify Other field to collect more details on a prespecified CEDECOD value, or when CEDECOD=Other. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF
field_label: Reported Term for the Clinical Event
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the clinical event term?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a prespecified clinical event or a group of clinical events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH variable CEOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of prespecified clinical event not considered to be an adverse event by the sponsor. CEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported events. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified clinical event/group of clinical events ]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
field_implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the clinical event is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both prespecified CEs and free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free text. CEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start date of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] start date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start time of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time a CE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE start time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] start time?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field_implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the clinical event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field_implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the end date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., CEENRF, CEENRTPT). When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in CEENTPT.
field_prompt: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])
field_questionText: Was the [clinical event] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
field_implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
field_questionText: What was the severity of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of toxicity quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
field_implementationNotes: This would typically be the text description quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
field_questionText: What was the description of the toxicity?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). field_definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
field_implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade. CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3; TOXGRV4) may be used.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
field_questionText: What was the toxicity grade?

field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the clinical event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the CECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. CESCAT can only be used if there is an CECAT and it must be a subcategorization of CECAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subcategory of the clinical event?

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether any clinical events were experienced during the study.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were any clinical events experienced?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with CEs. If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The reported or prespecified name of the clinical event.
field_implementationNotes: Can be represented either as a free-text field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects; or preprinted, in situation where solicited CEs of interest are captured. May be used as Specify Other field to collect more details on a prespecified CEDECOD value, or when CEDECOD=Other. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF
field_label: Reported Term for the Clinical Event
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the clinical event term?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a prespecified clinical event or a group of clinical events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH variable CEOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of prespecified clinical event not considered to be an adverse event by the sponsor. CEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported events. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified clinical event/group of clinical events ]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
field_implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the clinical event is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both prespecified CEs and free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free text. CEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start date of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] start date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The start time of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time a CE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE start time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] start time?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field_implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the clinical event?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field_implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the end date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., CEENRF, CEENRTPT). When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in CEENTPT.
field_prompt: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])
field_questionText: Was the [clinical event] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
field_implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
field_questionText: What was the severity of the [clinical event]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). field_definition: A description of toxicity quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
field_implementationNotes: This would typically be the text description quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
field_questionText: What was the description of the toxicity?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). field_definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
field_implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade. CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3; TOXGRV4) may be used.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
field_questionText: What was the toxicity grade?

field_definition: If the value for CETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then CEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
field_implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

field_definition: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of CETERM or the modified topic variable (CEMODIFY), if applicable.
field_implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The dictionary-derived code for the primary system organ class (SOC).
field_implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as CEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.
field_label: CE Primary System Organ Class Code
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the protocol deviation?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the DVCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DVSCAT can only be used if there is an DVCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DVCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subcategory of the protocol deviation?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether there were any protocol deviations.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were there any protocol deviations?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The sponsor-defined standardized text for the name of the protocol deviation.
field_implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a codelist of responses, then DVDECOD should be used to store the codelist response. Sponsors must use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF and, in some cases, both may be used. For example, if the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of codelist items, then DVTERM should be used to store the detailed descriptive text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the (standardized) protocol deviation (term/(code)?

class_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). domain_description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The reported or prespecified name of the protocol deviation.
field_implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a free-text field, then DVTERM should be used to store the free-text response. Sponsors may use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF, but a value in DVTERM is required in the SDTM-based datasets.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the protocol deviation term?

field_definition: The start date of deviation, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: This may be derived if not collected on a CRF.

field_definition: An indication of whether a health encounter occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH variable HOOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a prespecified healthcare encounter. HOOCCUR is not used if the healthcare encounters are collected on the CRF in a manner that requires a free-text response. The site should be able to indicate in a separate item (or system variable) that the question was not asked or answered.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified healthcare encounter term]?

field_definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are specified on a CRF.
field_implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation, when the healthcare encounter is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both prespecified healthcare encounters as well as free-text events, the value of HOPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free-text. HOPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

field_definition: The reported or prespecified name of the healthcare encounter.
field_implementationNotes: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor-defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE - PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE - HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.
