domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in OEORRES.
field_implementationNotes: OEORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable OESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_label: Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Normal references ranges that are expressed as characters ("Negative to Trace") or ordinal (-1 to 1).
field_implementationNotes: Should be populated for normal ranges that are reported as character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the normal reference range (for this [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
field_implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by OEORNRLO, OEORNRHI, OESTNRC, or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indicator of the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results.
field_implementationNotes: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results (e.g., "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE"). The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the the category for the reported values?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When OEREASND is used, OESTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the reason that the [ophthalmic examination finding] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.
field_implementationNotes: For the OE domain, this value is prepopulated as "EYE". It does not need to be preprinted on the CRF or collected.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location of the ophthalmic examination?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location of the OETEST within a given eye. It should never be used to designate "Right Eye" versus "Left Eye". OEFOCID is used to denote which eye is the focus of the observation. This may be preprinted or collected.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: Further detailing the directionality of the location of the OETEST (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field_implementationNotes: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location of the OETEST. This may be preprinted or collected.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The method of the test or examination.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Who was the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Is this record considered to be the [accepted/final] evaluation?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
field_implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column .
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subject identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the RE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RE CRF using the Respiratory Assessments (REDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
field_implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable RESTAT. If the CDASH variable REPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable RESTAT is "NOT DONE". If REPERF= "Y", RESTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., RECAT and RESCAT, RETPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable RETESTCD would be populated with REALL and an appropriate test name (RETEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was a respiratory assessment performed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date the respiratory measurement was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The date the RE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RE CRF using the Date of Collection (REDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable REDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date the respiratory measurement was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: A single collection time (e.g., RETIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [RETESTCD]_RETIM.
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable REDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the respiratory system measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
field_implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.
field_label: RE Assessment Planned Time Point Name
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors RETPTREF (text description) and RERFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables RETPTNUM, REELTM.
field_questionText: What is the planned time point for this respiratory assessment measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
field_implementationNotes: The test name will usually be pre-printed on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. RETEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable RETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RETEST using the Controlled Terminology List RETESTCD. The SDTMIG variables RETESTCD and RETEST are required in SDTM.
field_questionText: What is the respiratory test name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the respiratory test?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the RECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. RESCAT can only be used if there is a RECAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RECAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the respiratory assessment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
field_label: RE Test Result in Original Units
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the result of the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the unit of the result?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH field RERES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable REORRES and must be transformed. For example,RERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected.REORES is collected using Normal, Abnormal and a description of the abnormality is collected.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation; for example: \n 1. Where RERES is to used collect Normal, Abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., Absent/Present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field REDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field RERES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables REORRES and RESTRESC with the value of the CDASH field RERES. If the CDASH field RERES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable REORRES with the CDASH field REDESC. If the reported findings in REDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable RESTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and REMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in REDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable RESTRESC is populated with the CDASH REDESC field. The SDTM variable RENRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. \n 2. Where RERES is used to collect standardized values (e.g. a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field RERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field RERES field is mapped to the SDTM variable RESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field RERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable REORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Text description of respiratory test findings.
field_implementationNotes: RERES and REDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See CDASH General finding Assumptions
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable REORRES. If RERES="Normal", populate REORRES with the value of RERES. If RERES="Abnormal", populate REORRES with the value of REDESC.
field_questionText: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
field_implementationNotes: In cases where RERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field RERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".
field_mappingInstructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field RERES is mapped to the SDTM variable RESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field RERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable REORRES.
field_questionText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in REORRES.
field_implementationNotes: REORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable RESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_label: RE Ref Range Lower Limit- Original Unit
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the lower limit of the reference range?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in REORRES.
field_implementationNotes: REORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable RESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_label: RE Ref Range Upper Limit- Original Unit
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the upper limit of the reference range?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
field_implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by REORNRLO, REORNRHI, RESTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field_implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH REPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for REREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
field_questionText: Indicate if the [RETEST] was not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When REREASND is used, RESTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was the was the reason that the respiratory (assessment/[RETEST]) was not [collected / answered / done / assessed / evaluated]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
field_implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for respiratory test, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [RETESTCD]_REPOS may be created for each RETESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the position of the subject during the assessment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Location used for the measurement.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the respiratory test?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The method of the test or examination.
field_implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Who was the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL.
field_implementationNotes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Use where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was this record considered to be the accepted evaluation?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
field_implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
field_implementationNotes: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation, as required by the protocol.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was this result clinically significant?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the reproductive system findings were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the reproductive system findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RP CRF using the date (RPDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the category of the reproductive system?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the RPCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. RPSCAT can only be used if there is an RPCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RPCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the reproductive system?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed.
field_implementationNotes: This may be implemented for a series of reproductive system evaluations, or a specific reproductive system test. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RPSTAT. If the CDASH field RPPERF="N", the value of RPSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RPPERF="Y", RPSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., RPCAT and RPSCAT, RPTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD would be populated as RPALL and an appropriate test name (RPTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was a reproductive system evaluation performed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the reason the reproductive system test was not collected?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: General prompt question regarding whether any reproductive system findings are available.
field_implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Were there any reproductive system findings?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name for reproductive system finding.
field_implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RPTEST. The SDTMIG variables RPTESTCD and RPTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
field_questionText: What is the reproductive finding name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Result of the finding defined in reproductive system finding, as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
field_label: RP Result or Finding in Original Units
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the result for the reproductive system question?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date on which the reproductive system result or finding was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date the reproductive system question was collected?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)

field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)

field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
