domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
field_implementationNotes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.
field_implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and the this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor/lesion.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the [tumor/lesion] (link) identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The identifier for the procedure used to identify the tumor.
field_implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the TU identified and the procedure undergone to identify this tumor/lesion. TUPRNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the TU dataset and records in the PR dataset. See SDTMIG for information on RELREC.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the PR domain.
field_questionText: What was the identifier for the procedure used to identify this [tumor/lesion] ?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Method of the test or examination.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsors may collect the method used to identify the tumor/lesions via a codelist which includes the most commonly known or generally recognized terms. The values will represent the method generically, not the product of the method (e.g., photograph). A sponsor may customize or restrict the list of values per response criteria or protocol needs. At a minimum, the primary method of identification should be entered and is expected to be consistent throughout the study; recording secondary methods is at the discretion of the sponsor.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the method used to [evaluate/identify] the [tumor/lesion]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An internal or external identifier, such as image ID number (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound identifier).
field_implementationNotes: This variable may be used to collect a reference/accession number associated with the method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Sponsors may use the CDASH variable TUPRNO as an identifier for a procedure.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the procedure [reference identifier/accession number]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.
field_implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable TUTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TUTEST. The SDTMIG variables TUTESTCD and TUTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
field_questionText: What was the [tumor/lesion] Identification test name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Result of the tumor identification (e.g., classification or type of tumor).
field_implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable TESTCD (e.g., TUMERGE, TUSPLIT, TUMIDENT) or TESTCD_TUORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the TU test code. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the [type/classification] of [tumor/lesion] as defined by the criteria being employed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location. A location detail text field (TULOCDTL) is conditional for entry (i.e., can be left blank) and allows the study site to specify the lesion in its own terms or can be used to distinguish tumors within the same location if other location qualifiers are not specific enough.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [tumor/lesion] (identified)?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the laterality of the anatomical location?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A detailed description of the location of the identified tumor/lesion.
field_implementationNotes: Use if TULOC and TULAT and/or TUDIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified tumors. TULOCDTL is not meant to replace TULOC, TULAT, and/or TUDIR or serve as the free-text description field for TULOC (e.g., Location, Other).
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPTU dataset as the value of SUPPTU.QVAL where SUPPTU.QNAM="TULOCDTL" and SUPPTU.QLABEL= "TU Identification Location Detail".
field_questionText: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the [tumor/lesion] so that it can be distinguished from other [tumor/lesion] in the same anatomical location?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
field_implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the name of the vendor used?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subject identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the UR measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the UR CRF using the Urinary Assessments (URDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VISDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
field_implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable URSTAT. If the CDASH variable URPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable URSTAT is "NOT DONE". If URPERF= "Y", URSTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., URCAT and URSCAT, URTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable URTESTCD would be populated with URALL and an appropriate test name (URTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was a urinary assessment performed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date the urinary measurement was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The date the UR measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the UR CRF using the Date of Collection (URDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable URDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date the urinary measurement was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable URDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the urinary system measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
field_implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.
field_label: UR Assessment Planned Time Point Name
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors URTPTREF (text description) and URRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables URTPTNUM, URELTM.
field_questionText: What is the planned time point for this urinary assessment measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
field_implementationNotes: The test name will usually be preprinted on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. URTEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable URTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in URTEST using the Controlled Terminology List URNSTSCD. The SDTMIG variables URTESTCD and URTEST are required in SDTM.
field_questionText: What is the urinary test name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. URSCAT can only be used if there is a URCAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the category of the urinary test?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the URCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. URSCAT can only be used if there is a URCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of URCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the urinary assessment?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
field_label: UR Test Result in Original Units
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the result of the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the unit of the result?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: The CDASH field URRES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable URORRES and must be transformed. For example,URRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected.URORRES is collected using "Normal", "Abnormal", and a description of the abnormality is collected.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation, for example: \n 1. Where URRES is used to collect normal/abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., absent/present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field URDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field URRES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables URORRES and URSTRESC with the value of the CDASH field URRES. If the CDASH field URRES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable URORRES with the CDASH field URDESC. If the reported findings in URDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable URSTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and URMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in URDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable URSTRESC is populated with the CDASH URDESC field. \n 2. Where URRES is used to collect standardized values (e.g. a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field URRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field URRES field is mapped to the SDTM variable URSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field URRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable URORRES. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Text description of urinary test findings.
field_implementationNotes: URRES and URDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See Section 8.3.1, General CDASH Assumptions for Findings Domains.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable URORRES. If URRES="Normal", populate URORRES with the value of URRES. If URRES="Abnormal", populate URORRES with the value of URDESC.
field_questionText: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
field_implementationNotes: In cases where URRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field URRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".
field_mappingInstructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field URRES is mapped to the SDTM variable URSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field URRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable URORRES.
field_questionText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field_implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH URPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for URREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
field_questionText: Indicate if the [URTEST] was not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When URREASND is used, URSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was the was the reason that the urinary (assessment/[URTEST]) was not [collected / answered / done / assessed / evaluated]?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Location used for the measurement.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the urinary test?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The method of the test or examination.
field_implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Who was the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in UREVAL.
field_implementationNotes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Use where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was this record considered to be the accepted evaluation?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
field_implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
field_implementationNotes: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation, as required by the protocol.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
field_questionText: Was this result clinically significant?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the subject identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
field_implementationNotes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name VSTEST provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Were vital signs performed?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date of the vital signs measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the vital signs measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
field_implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.
field_label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.
field_questionText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the category of the vital signs?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
field_implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
field_implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in VSTEST. Both VSTESTCD and VSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC CT for the test and test code.
field_questionText: What is the vital sign test name?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field_implementationNotes: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be 1 checkbox for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual VS tests to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
field_label: VS Result or Finding in Original Units
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the result of the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: This should be preprinted on the CRF (or enterable from a picklist) with the associated test when possible, rather than collected as free-text.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the unit of the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Was the result clinically significant?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of vital signs measurements.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
field_implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the position of the subject during the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record.
