(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the finding about measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Findings About Date (FADAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.
field_implementationNotes: The FAOBJ will usually be preprinted or hidden, not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.
field_label: Findings About Object of the Observation
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: [Sponsored-defined phrase]

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether data was collected for the finding topic.
field_implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field, it provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, or observations were done.
field_mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
field_questionText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
field_implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date when the findings about assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The date the FA measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Date of Collection (FADAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date the findings about assessment was performed?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the findings about assessment?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
field_implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.
field_implementationNotes: It is recommended that the test detail name be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the FACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. FASCAT can only be used if there is an FACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

field_definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/ test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection])?

field_definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
field_label: FA Result or Finding in Original Units
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field_implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.
field_implementationNotes: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_label: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
field_label: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

field_definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
field_implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by FAORNRLO, FAORNRHI, FASTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field_implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH FAPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for FAREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
field_questionText: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated ]?; Indicate if the([--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An explanation of why data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Was the [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

field_definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
field_implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the specimen type?

field_definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination]) or What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen] was taken/collected)?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_label: Laterality of Location of Finding About
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e.,arrangement of, apportioning of).
field_implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations of the location of the FATEST. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

field_definition: Method of the test or examination.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination])?

field_definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
field_implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in FAEVAL.
field_implementationNotes: This variable is used in conjunction with FAEVAL to provide an additional level of detail.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase-information)?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPFA dataset as the value of SUPPFA.QVAL when SUPPFA.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPFA.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
field_questionText: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination]) result clinically significant?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field_implementationNotes: The name of the visit is typically preprinted on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. \n Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit-numbering or visit-naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In such cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when creating SDTM submission datasets.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the visit name?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field_implementationNotes: The date the skin response measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the skin response measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Skin Response CRF using the date (SRDAT) field.
field_mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether a planned skin response measurement, series of skin response measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
field_implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF="N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF="Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name (SRTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
field_questionText: Was a skin response test performed?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. field_definition: An explanation for why data are not available.
field_implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When SRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the reason the test was not done?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the category of the skin response?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sub-division of the SRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field_implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. SRSCAT can only be used if there is an SRCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of SRCAT.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the subcategory of the skin response?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field_implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
field_questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by SRTEST.
field_label: Skin Response Object of the Observation
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What intervention was performed to elicit the skin response?

It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the SR CRF.
field_label: SR Date of Reference Time Point
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The time of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations).
field_label: SR Time of Reference Time Point
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

field_definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of skin response test.
field_implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., arm for skin response). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
field_implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
field_label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. SRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SRTEST. The SDTMIG variables SRTESTCD and SRTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
field_questionText: What was the skin response test name?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field_implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.
field_label: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. Time-point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) and SRRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
field_questionText: What was the planned time point for skin response measurement?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: The date of the measurements, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field_implementationNotes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the date of the skin response measurement?

field_definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field_implementationNotes: The time of measurement (if required) can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
field_questionText: What was the time of the skin response measurement?

field_definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field_implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

field_definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
field_implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: Who was the evaluator?

field_definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in SREVAL.
field_implementationNotes: If EVALID needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ EVALID can be used.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
field_implementationNotes: The category of the value within the respective reference range. Ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

class_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: An indication of whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
field_implementationNotes: If this level of information is needed, it may be added to the CRF.
field_mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPSR dataset as the value of SUPPSR.QVAL where SUPPSR.QNAM ="SRCLSIG" and SUPPSR.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
field_questionText: Was the result clinically significant?

class_description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2023-06-30)
domain_description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2023-06-30)
field_definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field_implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the study identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2023-06-30)

field_definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What is the site identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2023-06-30)

field_definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field_implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. \n EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
field_questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

class_description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2023-06-30)

field_definition: A free-text comment.
field_implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide more information about a particular record, use the COVAL variable to collect the free text, and associate the free text (comment) with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL.
field_mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. RDOMAIN contains the domain to which the comment is related.
